comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: Elswick Ordnance Company was a major arms developer before and during World War I. The ordnance and ammunition it manufactured for the British Government were stamped EOC, while guns made for export were usually marked "W.G. Armstrong". en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elswick_Ordnance_Company#Elswick_Or...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.battleships-cruisers.co.uk/elswick.htm would suggest that this picture dates from 1898. The same picture (with less cropping) is captioned "View of the XI Shop The North bay, 1898; Original naval Magazine photograph of March 1898."

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for finding these images swanq.  I agree that they look like a match to the Bain photo.  We'll add this information to the record, the next time we update.
